home.subscribePopupDesc: Select your subscription type and subscribe to your service.
home.addMsg: Success! You are subscribed to {{service}} service
home.deleteMsg: Success! API key has been deleted successfully
home.apiPolicyDeleted: Success! All the API Keys and Policies were deleted.
home.unsubscribeDesc: All API keys will be deactivated and inactive. This cannot be undone unless you contact an administrator to restore your service.
home.unsubscribeConfirm: Are you sure you want to unsubscribe from the service?
home.editApi: Do you really want to edit this API Key?
home.delteApiMsg: API key “{{name}}” will be deleted. You will not be able to utilize the key after deleting.
home.delteApiConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this key?

service.noEntries: No Entries exist. To start subscribe to Amber Service Offering
service.description: Amber is a Software as a Service (SaaS) implementation of an independent trust authority that provides attestation of workloads in a public/private multi-cloud environment. You will need an API key for requesting an attestation token from Project Amber. Let us begin with three simple steps:
service.step3: 3. Download the Amber Client for integration with the workload and start the attestation flow. You can return to the portal to view your usage data and other metrics.
service.descriptionForAzureUser: Amber is a Software as a Service (SaaS) implementation of an independent trust authority that provides attestation of workloads in a public/private multi-cloud environment. You will need an API key for requesting an attestation token from Project Amber. Download the Amber Client for integration with the workload and start the attestation flow. You can return to the portal to view your usage data and other metrics.

subscriptions.noEntries: No API keys exist. Click on Add API Key to add a new API Key.
subscriptions.noPoliciesAttached: No Entries exist. To attach a policy click on the Add a policy button.
subscriptions.noTagsAttached: No Entries exist. To start click on the add a tag button
subscriptions.createApiSubPara: Please provide a user friendly name for your API key. The use of tags and user-defined policies are optional. Note: The number of API keys that can be generated are based on your service tier.
subscriptions.productSelectionTip: During the Pilot program, Premium Service Tier is provided by default.
subscriptions.apiKeyNameValidationMsg: API key name must contain at least 3 characters but not more than 64 characters. Characters allowed a-z, A-Z, 0-9 , -, _.  No spaces allowed.
subscriptions.customTagAndPolicyTitle: (optional) Assign custom tags and custom policies
subscriptions.provideApiKeyTip: TIP: For ease of identification, give your API key a unique name. Please refer to the
subscriptions.assignPolicySubHeading: Policies are a set of rules set using REGO policy formats that can be applied to the tenant workloads. It can be applied at a API key level, wherein a tenant can associate multiple policies to a given API Key or can associate multiple API keys to a single policy. Similarly at the workload/token level, we can associate multiple workloads to a given policy or can associate multiple policies to a single workload. Note: A system generated global policy is always applied.
subscriptions.signedPolicyIndicatorDescStart: Indicates that a policy is signed. There is more information posted about our
subscriptions.editSubPara: A default system generated policy is always processed as part of the attestation flow. You can update the tags and user-defined policies associated with this API key.
subscriptions.tagPolicyTip: TIP: By default, the Amber Global Policy is applied to every API Key. The Global Policy verifies the platform TEE identity against the latest Intel TEE certificates and TCB level; which implies that it is patched and up to date. Tags and policies can always be updated by editing the API key from the API key table.
subscriptions.tagPolicyTipEditApiKey: TIP: By default, the Amber Global Policy is applied to every API Key. The Global Policy verifies the platform TEE identity against the latest Intel TEE certificates and TCB level; which implies that it is patched and up to date.
subscriptions.tagDesc: There are two types of assigned tags (Tag Name, Value Pairs) - Pre-Defined and User-Defined tags. This is used to identify usages or add unique attributes to the API key by the tenant.
subscriptions.apiAddMsg: Success! Your API key has been generated.
subscriptions.apiEditMsg: Success! Your API key info has been updated.
subscriptions.attachPolicySubHeading: Select an existing policy or create a new one.  All new policies will also be available for reuse for other API Keys.
subscriptions.createTagDesc: You can create new tag names here, then apply them to your new tag.
subscriptions.tagValidationMsg: Tag name must contain at least 3 characters but not more than 64 characters. Characters allowed a-z, A-Z, 0-9 , -, _.  No spaces allowed.
subscriptions.tagValueValidationMsg: Value must contain at least 3 characters but not more than 64 characters. Characters allowed a-z, A-Z, 0-9 , -, _.  No spaces allowed.
subscriptions.goBackdialogHeaderDesc: Unsaved data will be lost, API Key is not created
subscriptions.goBackdialogHeaderDescWithEdit: Unsaved data will be lost, API Key info is not saved

policy.noEntries: No entries exist. To start click on the add a policy button.
policy.policyNameValidation: Policy name must contain at least 3 characters but not more than 64 characters. Characters allowed a-z, A-Z, 0-9 , -, _.  No spaces allowed.
policy.tokenCustomizationPolicyTooltip: Allows customized claims that are part of the attestation token.  When used, the amber_custom_policy field would be populated
policy.appraisalPolicyTooltip: Evaluates the evidence provided and determines whether Amber will issue an attestation token
policy.uploadPolicyDesc1: There are two types of policies, signed or not signed. Signing verifies it's legitimacy, see the
policy.uploadPolicyDesc2: to view the signing policy tool or upload without signing.
policy.policyDescription: An attestation policy evaluates the evidence provided by the attestor and determines whether Amber will issue an attestation token. User-defined policies are optional, and a default system-generated policy is always processed as part of the attestation flow.
policy.policySubDescription1: Indicates that a policy is signed. There is more information posted about our
policy.policyLibDesc: User-defined policies can be viewed and managed below.
policy.deletePolicyDesc: Policy “{{name}}” will be deleted. It will no longer be available for evaluation in any attestation request.
policy.deletePolicyConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this policy?
policy.deletePolicyMsg: Success! Policy has been deleted successfully.
policy.addPolicySubTitle: Policies are sets of rules that can be applied to workloads. You can associate multiple policies with a workload or API key, and multiple workloads and API keys with a policy.
policy.editPolicyDesc: You are editing an existing policy, you will be able to edit the policy name and/or upload a new policy file.
policy.leavePopupAddPolicyDesc: Unsaved data will be lost, Policy is not saved
policy.leavePopupUpdatePolicyDesc: Unsaved data will be lost, Policy is not updated
policy.appraisalPolicyDesc: Evaluates the evidence provided and determines whether Amber will issue an attestation token.
policy.tokenCustomizationPolicyDesc: Allows customized claims that are part of the attestation token.  When used, the amber_custom_policy field would be populate.

profile.userProfileDesc: View your profile information captured in Amber.
profile.name: Name
profile.noEntries: No entries exist. To start click on the add User button.
profile.inviteHeader: Please enter the user details for the invitation to be sent
profile.inviteSent: Invitation has been sent to the user.

error.authTitle: You are not authorized to view this page
error.authSubTitle: You do not have the permission to view this page with the credentials that were provided.
error.notFoundTitle: Sorry, we could not find that page
error.notFoundSubTitle: You are trying to access a page that is not available.
error.internalErrorDesc: Something went wrong, please try again later.
error.badRequestDesc: This page is not working at the moment.
error.badRequestDescSessionExpired: Your session has expired. Please log back again.
error.badRequestDescInvalidToken: Not able to process the request. Please log back again.
error.badRequestDescPlanExist: A service tier plan already exists for this tenant. Please update your existing service tier to change your plan.
error.badRequestSuggestion: If the issue persist, please contact your Project Amber representative.
error.forbiddenDesc: You are trying to access a page that is unavailable or to which you do not have permission to access.
error.forbiddenSuggestion: If the issue persist, please contact your Project Amber representative.
error.serviceErrorDesc: The requested service is temporarily unavailable at this time.
error.serviceErrorSuggestion: If the issue persist, please contact your Project Amber representative.

manageUser.subPara: As a Tenant Admin, you have access to Manage Users dashboard. The role allows you to view, search and manage all users from your organization. Additionally, new users can be invited to join Amber and assigned a Tenant Admin or User role.
manageUser.subParaNote: Support for additional Tenant Admins or Users support is based on Amber product type, please refer to your subscription for more details.
manageUser.inviteUserSubTitle: Invite a user via email and assign an appropriate role.
manageUser.editUserSubTitle: An email will go to the user to communicate the change in role.
manageUser.deleteUserMsg: Success! User has been deleted successfully.
manageUser.deleteUserDesc: User “{{name}}” will be deleted. This user will no longer have access to the Amber system.
manageUser.deleteUserConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this user?
manageUser.editUserDesc: Do you really want to edit this user?
manageUser.leavePopupInviteDesc: Unsaved data will be lost, Invitation to user will not be sent
manageUser.leavePopupUpdateDesc: Unsaved data will be lost, User is not updated

reports.reportsDescription: A summary of the attestation tokens and API key usage for your subscription along with the status and response times can be accessed below. Amber supports pre-defined and custom reports that can be downloaded for specific time ranges.
reports.allService: All services and products by month
reports.usageData: Usage data by status for top 3 API keys by month
reports.timeframeDesc: Allows you to control the timeframe of the charts below.
reports.oneDayTimeframeInfo: DAY = A one day reporting period in 4-hour increments
reports.oneWeekTimeframeInfo: WEEK = A one week reporting period in daily increments
reports.oneMonthTimeframeInfo: MONTH = A one month reporting period in weekly increments
reports.oneQuarterTimeframeInfo: QUARTER = A one quarter reporting period in monthly increments
reports.oneYearTimeframeInfo: YEAR = A one year reporting period in 3-month increments
reports.noReportExistDescription: An API key must be generated to display charts and trending data.

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.subTitle: Developer training and Project Amber resources
documentation.description: This page contains videos and articals about attestation policies, UI Workflows, and other resources that Project Amber uses to protect your applications.
documentation.apiVideoDesc: Brief overview of API keys and explains what they are used for in Project Amber.
documentation.tagsVideoDesc: What tags are and how they are used in Project Amber.
documentation.attestationPolicyVideoDesc: Presents an overview of what an attestation policy is and how it is used in Project Amber.
documentation.manageUsersVideoDesc: Explains the types of users in Project Amber and how they are managed.
documentation.articleOverviewDesc: This article provides an overview of Project Amber's key benefits and gives a quick overview of how to get started using it.
documentation.articleWorkflowsDesc: These articles provide step by step guides on how to perform various functions in Project Amber, such as creating a user, policy management, service management, and other functions.
documentation.articleGramineDesc: The articles in this section contain information on how to integrate Project Amber into your applications.
documentation.articleTenantCliDesc: These articles contain instructions for installing the CLI client and walkthroughs for the various workflows.
documentation.articleAPIDesc: The articles in this section include definitions for all public REST APIs supported by Project Amber, including sample calls with required request/response headers, any applicable parameter options, and sample responses.
documentation.articleUtilitiesDesc: Some Project Amber use cases require a downloadable utility to provide client-side functionality. The articles in this section contain user guides for these utilities.

download.downloadCenterDesc: Welcome to the Download Center. This page contains the Project Amber client and all the tools needed to unlock its full potential.
download.amberClientDesc: Visit the open-source Github repository to download the Project Amber Libraries, the CLI, and other services.
download.amberSigningDesc: Download JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) certificates for Project Amber.
download.faithfulVerificationToolDesc: The Project Amber Faithful Verifier(FV) tools is a Linux command-line utility that verifies the fidelity of a Project Amber token.
download.keyBrokerServiceDesc: Key Broker Service Use Case, Integration Guidance and Download.
download.teeCachingServiceDesc: TEE Caching Service Integration and download for Infrastructure Operators.
download.policySigningToolDesc: The Policy Signing tool is a Command-line utility used to sign user-defined policies.
download.title: Documentation

notificationPreferences.notificationPreferencesDescription: Please confirm your notification preferences so we can update you.
notificationPreferences.notificationPreferences1: I would like to receive attestation failure email notifications.
notificationPreferences.notificationPreferences2: I would like to receive service update email notifications. (for future use)
notificationPreferences.notificationPrefTooltip: Note: This email address can be different from primary email address.
notificationPreferences.updateSuccessAlertMessage: Notification preferences has been updated successfully.

adminApi.title: Admin API Keys
adminApi.description: To manage users using the Command Line Interface (CLI), the tenant admin will require an admin API key. You can access these auto-generated API keys by using copy function into your command entry.
adminApi.regenerateDialogDescription: API key “{{name}}” will be deleted and a new key will be re-generated. You will not be able to utilize the previous key after deleting.
adminApi.regenerateDialogConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete and re-generate this key?
adminApi.regenerateSuccessAlertMessage: Admin API key has been re-generated successfully.
